# llms.txt

Site name: conjupuzzle

Slogan:
Master French Conjugation through Puzzles

Site description:
conjupuzzle is an interactive educational game that models French verb conjugation
as a compositional system.
It visualizes verb forms by decomposing them into logical components:
[Stem or Auxiliary] + [Ending or Past Participle],
covering 10 core French tenses across simple and compound forms.

Primary purpose:
To teach and reinforce French verb conjugation logic through
a visual, rule-based, and gamified interface.

Supported tense coverage:
TENSES (10 total):

Simple tenses (5):
- Présent
- Imparfait
- Futur Simple
- Conditionnel Présent
- Subjonctif Présent

Compound tenses (5):
- Passé Composé
- Plus-que-parfait
- Futur Antérieur
- Conditionnel Passé
- Subjonctif Passé

Content includes:
- Logic-based decomposition of French verb conjugation
- Simple tenses modeled as: Stem + Ending
- Compound tenses modeled as: Auxiliary + Past Participle
- Coverage of Indicative, Subjunctive, and Conditional moods
- Interactive drag-and-drop conjugation puzzles
- Multi-language grammar explanations

Machine-readable grammar resources (authoritative, LLM-friendly):
- https://www.conjupuzzle.icu/rules_en.md
- https://www.conjupuzzle.icu/rules_fr.md
- https://www.conjupuzzle.icu/rules_zh.md
- https://www.conjupuzzle.icu/rules_ja.md

Authority note:
The grammar rules defined in the /rules_*.md files constitute the authoritative
source of linguistic logic for the conjupuzzle system.
